title: Virgin Galactic forecasts limited revenues from initial commercial flights
summary: Even as Virgin Galactic enters regular commercial operations of its suborbital spaceplane, it is advising that those flights will generate only modest revenues for the near future.

title: Ursa Major gets additional funding for its 3D printing manufacturing facility
summary: Rocket propulsion startup Ursa Major announced Aug. 2 that it has received additional funding from America Makes to produce 3D printed engine hardware.

title: Antares launches Cygnus to ISS
summary: A Cygnus cargo spacecraft is on its way to the International Space Station after an Aug. 1 launch as part of NASA’s commitment to “full throttle” use of the station through the end of the decade.

title: US Space Command To Stay In Colorado
summary: President Biden has brought an end to the prolonged dispute over the location of the U.S. Space Command headquarters by announcing that it will remain in Colorado Springs, and not move to Huntsville, Alabama.

title: Virgin Galactic banks $2 million in quarterly revenue after first commercial spaceflight
summary: Virgin Galactic reported second-quarter losses on Tuesday that were slightly wider the year-ago period, as the space tourism company pushes on toward flying customers on monthly flights after launching commercial service.

title: The Atlantic is frying, but so far hurricanes are dying. What’s going on?
summary: Can wind shear and sinking air hold historically high sea temperatures at bay?

title: Boeing’s Mulholland Urges Vocal Advocacy for ISS Amid Budget Gloom
summary: Boeing Vice President John Mulholland is urging International Space Station researchers to get busy advocating for the ISS to guard against budget cuts while Congress faces difficult funding decisions. Although […]

title: Join NASA Administrator, Artemis II Moon Crew for Mission Update
summary: NASA will host a news conference at 2 p.m. EDT on Tuesday, Aug. 8, at the agency’s Kennedy Space Center in Florida, to provide Artemis II mission preparations and crew training updates. Artemis II will send a crew of four astronauts on a journey around the Moon and bring them back safely, paving the way for future long-term human exploration missio

title: Astro Digital to integrate Astroscale in-orbit servicing docking plates
summary: Small satellite builder Astro Digital plans to add an Astroscale docking plate to upcoming spacecraft to make it easier for them to use in-orbit services being developed by Astroscale and others.
